com.opendxl.client.message

Class Request

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opendxl.client.message.Message
      • com.opendxl.client.message.Request

  • public class Request
extends Message
    A Request messages are sent using the DxlClient.syncRequest(com.opendxl.client.message.Request) and DxlClient.asyncRequest(com.opendxl.client.message.Request, com.opendxl.client.callback.ResponseCallback, long) methods of a client instance. Request messages are used when invoking a method on a remote service. This communication is one-to-one where a client sends a request to a service instance and in turn receives a response.

      • getServiceId

        public java.lang.String getServiceId()
        Returns the identifier of the service that this request will be routed to. If an identifier is not specified, the initial broker that receives the request will select the service to handle the request (round-robin by default).
        Returns:
        The identifier of the service that this request will be routed to.

      • setServiceId

        public void setServiceId(java.lang.String serviceId)
        Sets the identifier of the service that this request will be routed to.
        Parameters:
